Record.Value: Fabrication
Practical Training: Stage III
Practical Training: Stage III
Welcome Cadet. Far from Earth, Stationeers must forge their own resources from local materials. So it's time to test your knowledge of mining and fabrication.
Practical Training: Stage III
To finish this part of the base, you need a Hydraulic Pipebender to create items like airlock components. But first, you need raw materials. Your tablet will lead you to them.
Get tablet from crate.
Practical Training: Stage III
Tablets perform different functions depending on what cartridge is inserted. Add a tracker cartridge
Add tracker cartridge from crate to tablet.
Turn tablet on.
Use the tablet to navigate to the beacon we've placed near ore deposit.
Navigate to the bacon
Use the drill in your mining belt to mine ore. The ore will appear directly in your belt once mined.
Equip mining drill from mining belt
Turn on drill
Mine 30 iron.
Get that ore back to the base and lets get smelting.
Return to the base
Raw ore has to be turned into ingots before it can be used. For that you need an arc furnace. Grab a kit from the crate and place it in the highlighted area.
Get an arc furnace kit from crate.
Place arc furnace in highlighted area.
Connect arc furnace to power.
Now you're ready to smelt iron. Add your iron ore to the arc furnace.
Turn arc furnace on
Add iron ore to arc furnace
Activate arc furnace
Arc furnace produces pure ore ingots, which provide resources for fabrication devices. (Note: We've sped it up for you this time)
Pick up ingot behind arc furnace
Add ingot to autolathe
To make a Hydraulic Pipebender, you need copper, iron and gold. Grab other ingots from the crate and add them to the autolathe.
Pick Up Copper Ingot From Crate.
Add copper ingot to autolathe.
Pick Up Gold Ingot From Crate.
Add gold ingot to autolathe
Use the autolathe to make a pipebender kit
Turn on autolathe.
Select hydraulic pipe bender recipe using search function.
Print hydraulic pipe bender kit
Pick Up Kit Hydraulic Pipe Bender
Place hydraulic pipe bender in highlighted position
Now that the pipe benders frame is in place we need to complete it, Just like the Autolathe follow the tips to finish construction.
Using the resources found in the crate, Complete Pipe Bender.
Turn On the pipeBender.
You can take ingots out of machines, if you need them in a hurry somewhere else. Eject ingots from the autolathe by pulling lever, then put them in the hydraulic pipe bender.
Pull autolathe lever to eject ingots
Put Iron Ingot into PipeBender
Put Copper Ingot into PipeBender
Put Gold Ingot into PipeBender
The next stage of testing will see you creating airlocks. One of the key components is a vent. Print a vent on the hydraulic pipe bender.
Select Active Vent On PipeBender.
Fabricate Active Vent Using PipeBender.
Turn Off Pipebender Once fabrication is complete.
Pick Up the Active Vent.

Good work, Cadet. You've built a fabrication system. That's the last step of Practical Testing, Phase III. Press the 'Complete' button to transmit your results to Stationeer Command, and we'll move on.
Press button to complete test.
